item.title: Versant CEO Mark Lazarus on the new Versant, what it might buy, and life after cable
item.description: Lazarus envisions Versant as a bridge between the past and future of media.

item.title: The Dispatch expands into DC analysis
item.description: The company is rolling out a new policy vertical for the Beltway set.

item.title: Arab News taps AI for global reach
item.description: Saudi Arabia’s oldest English-language daily will translate its coverage into 50 languages using tech from Dubai-based CAMB.AI.

item.title: Americans’ trust in media hits new low, poll finds
item.description: Only 28% of US adults told Gallup they have a ‘great deal’ or ‘fair amount’ of trust that mass media will report the news fully, accurately, and fairly.

item.title: Trump in talks to appear on CBS’ ’60 Minutes’
item.description: The potential interview comes just months after Paramount settled a lawsuit with the Trump campaign over a “60 Minutes” interview with Kamala Harris.

item.title: Washington Post economics columnist moves to The Bulwark
item.description: Catherine Rampell will write a weekly economics and policy-focused newsletter for the anti-Trump media brand.

item.title: Bari Weiss starts as CBS News’ top editor
item.description: She’ll still be at The Free Press, the website she founded.

item.title: Univision takes out ad touting Trump praise on Truth Social
item.description: Univision moved quickly to sponsor a laudatory post from the president.

item.title: Weiss makes first major CBS moves
item.description: The new editor-in-chief booked three former secretaries of state for a roundtable related to the war in Gaza.

item.title: The three challenges Bari Weiss is facing at CBS
item.description: Weiss’ journey to this point may have been the easy part.

item.title: Trump’s inevitable Nobel
item.description: One of Trump’s core political insights has always been to see through institutions to the individuals who run them. Will the Nobel Institute be next?

item.title: LA Times scrambles for cash ahead of 2027 IPO
item.description: Patrick Soon-Shiong’s media outfit aims to raise up to $500 million.

item.title: Outkick founder considering leaving Fox to start new media project
item.description: The conservative sports brand Outkick was acquired by Fox Corp. in 2021.

item.title: Can MS survive without NBC? Inside CEO Mark Lazarus’ efforts to save cable’s great brands
item.description: MSNBC and 10 other television channels are splitting from NBC over the next several weeks to form a new digital-focused, publicly traded company called Versant.

item.title: Blackbird Spyplane’s Jonah Weiner on Substack, resisting selling out, and Obama’s pants legacy
item.description: Blackbird Spyplane, a style and culture newsletter, launched in 2020 as one of the early adopters and success stories on Substack.

item.title: Alison Roman on cookbooks, food influencers, and the surprising way AI is changing her recipes
item.description: Alison Roman was one of digital media’s first food stars. With her latest cookbook, she’s trying to move away from life on the Internet.

item.title: US journalists protest over Pentagon press crackdown
item.description: Journalists from every major news organization gave their press passes back in protest over new reporting rules.

item.title: Governor JB Pritzker on Chicago, ICE, and the information war with Trump’s White House
item.description: Chicago is either a war zone quickly spiraling out of control, or a peaceful city under siege by an overreaching federal government. It all depends on who you ask — and which channel they watch.
